tool.name: MAKER to SNAP ZFF
tool.description: Convert files to SNAP's ZFF format
tool.command: maker2zff_wrap $ann $dna #if $filter.accept_all == "1" -n #else -c $filter.c -e $filter.e -o $filter.o -a $filter.a -t $filter.t -l $filter.l -x $filter.x #end if #if $check.mode == "0" #for $i, $obj in enumerate( $gffs ) $obj.gff #end for #else $index #end if

param.name: mode
param.label: Will you be providing a MAKER index datastore file?

param.name: accept_all
param.label: Do you want to accept all genes?

param.name: c
param.label: Fraction of splice sites confirmed by EST alignment
param.help: A value between 0 and 1. Default is 0.5

param.name: e
param.label: Fraction of exons that overlap an EST alignment
param.help: A value between 0 and 1. Default is 0.5

param.name: o
param.label: Fraction of exons that overlap any evidence (EST or Protein)
param.help: A value between 0 and 1. Default is 0.5

param.name: a
param.label: Fraction of splice sites confirmed by ab-initio prediction
param.help: A value between 0 and 1. Default is 0

param.name: t
param.label: Fraction of exons that overlap an ab-initio prediction
param.help: A value between 0 and 1. Default is 0

param.name: l
param.label: Min length of the protein sequence produced by the mRNA

param.name: x
param.label: Max AED to allow
param.help: A value between 0 and 1. A lower value indicates a higher confidence. Default is 0.5

tool.help: This tool will help convert MAKER's annotation result into SNAP's ZFF format for training SNAP. You can choose to provide the datastore index (also known as the Individual Contig Results file) or provide GFF3 files. You can also set the threshold to ensure that only high confidence annotations are passed to the training set.
